result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: ORDER FOR PROTECTION

Defendant Matthew J Gribben appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Keith Venema appearing for Bradley J. Lochowicz in court for Matthew J Gribben.  Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Offer received yesterday. defense would like more time to go over offer with defendant. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Stipulation for Protective Order

Defendant Matthew J Gribben appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Bradley J. Lochowicz in court for Matthew J Gribben.  Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Parties have an agreement on protective order, need to go over discovery. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Harvey Final Bill
The original document was titled: Attorney Harvey Final Bill
The original history event date is: 09-01-2022
Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court
Not guilty plea entered by counsel and trial reserved.

Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Matthew J Gribben in court, in custody by video. Attorney Bradley J. Lochowicz in court for Matthew J Gribben. Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Matthew J Gribben appeared by video, in custody.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by DDA Sempf.  Attorney Bradley J. Lochowicz in court for Matthew J Gribben. Called @ 2:13 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for adjourned initial appearance. Record by Atty. Lochowicz that the defendant wishes to waive his preliminary hearing, but state does not have information and he is unwilling to waive preliminary hearing until he confirms charges are the same as criminal complaint. Response by Atty. Sempf who objects and asks that the State have more time to file information due to seriousness of charges. Further discussion. State to have information prepared by August 3rd and sets matter for waiver of preliminary hearing before assigned judge - Koss
Waiver of Prelim scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Matthew J Gribben appeared by video, in custody.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by JJ Crawford. Called @ 1:53 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for Initial Appearance. Court addresses defendant as to attorney. Court sets matter over until next week to see if Defendant has attorney.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Petition for Appointment of an Attorney
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH M.B. dob 11-29-2013, L.P. dob 12-25-2010, S.B.C. dob 11-05-2011, M.S. dob 07-02-2015. NO CONTACT WITH MINORS OTHER THAN INCIDENTAL. NO EMPLOYMENT THAT INVOLVES CHILDREN IN ANY WAY. NO CONTACT WITH THE ROCK OF JESUS CHRIST CHURCH. NO CONTACT WITH DOUSMAN TRANSPORT BUS SERVICES. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Matthew J Gribben in court, in custody by video. Zeke Wiedenfeld appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Mackenzie Renner appeared. Defendant referred to SPD. Defendant is primary caretaker for disabled brother. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
